page.title: 10NEWSPAPERS
page.content: The Press & Journal, Aberdeen. Together the Press & Journal and its sister paper the Evening Express are read by nearly 450,000 people, about 3/4 of Grampian's population. Founded in 1784 by James Chalmers, the newspaper was originally printed and published in Castle St. before moving to Broad St. in the city centre.During the 20th C. amalgamation took place with the Aberdeen Free Press to form Aberdeen Journals Ltd. The move to the present location took place in 1970. Among the best 'scoops' was the Express coverage of the story of Britain's first surrogate mother, while the P&J has launched many spectacularly successful appeals such as the Cavitron Appeal and the recent 'Save our Shipyard ' campaign.
